article_node.title: I flew 1,500 miles to European city people warned me not to visit
article_node.summary: Naples is a vibrant, chaotic city steeped in history, known for its lively streets, iconic pizza, and pastry delicacies, yet it has a reputation for petty crime linked to the Camorra and the looming threat of Mount Vesuvius. Recent government efforts have reduced crime and improved the city’s image, encouraging tourists to explore beyond the Amalfi Coast. The author’s 48‑hour trip highlighted the energetic atmosphere of local pizzerias like Sorbillo, the authenticity of AVPN‑approved ingredients, and the rich pastry culture exemplified by Sfogliatelle. Despite warnings, the experience showcased Naples as a dynamic gem worth visiting, blending culinary excellence with cultural vibrancy.
